page.title: 17THE A5(T).
page.content: Our Domesday Block is traversed by an important main road called the A5(T). It was originally known as the London to Holyhead road. A surveyor was asked to carefully survey the road. This followed criticisms of the road surface made by Members of Parliament from Ireland who used the road regularly. The survey was completed in 1810. The survey included instructions on how to improve the road. Following this the road was improved considerably but it took a long time. It was not completed until 1825. However, by 1819 the most dangerous parts had been made safe and it was possible for stage coaches to use the road. Just outside our block there is an old coaching inn called the Lion Hotel which is situated at the top of Wyle Cop, Shrewsbury.
